keyPolicies.policyDescription: Decrease the Foreign Aid Budget, money saved will be put into the NHS and Social care.
Reform and re-open cottage hospitals to assist with the overflow of what is seen as "BED BLOCKING".
Following Brexit, fight for lower rates of Vat to stimulate the economy.
Ensure people visiting our country have adequate Health Insurance.
Ensure our Vulnerable and Disabled are treated with respect and dignity.
Reduce hospital waiting times and speed up diagnosis. NHS will remain FREE at the point of contact.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Alun is standing for several reasons, one being that he voted to leave the EU. He is disappointed that Theresa May has called an election.

issues.brexitEurope: Theresa May is insincere about Brexit and was herself a REMAINER. If elected, it's important to have a Brexiteer in parliament.
issues.economy: Following Brexit we would fight for lower rates of Vat to stimulate the economy. A higher threshold would help small businesses. Reduce business rates.
issues.health: Decrease the Foreign Aid Budget, money saved will be put into the NHS and Social care. NHS will remain FREE at the point of contact.
issues.immigration: Ensure people visiting our country have adequate Health Insurance.
issues.socialWelfare: Ensure Vulnerable and Disabled are treated with respect and dignity. Abolish the bedroom tax.

community.content: While walking around Bridgend Town Centre I was shocked to see the desperate & dishevelled state of the town. Shops closed or closing everywhere. Dirty and rundown streets. What a change today! Our town leaders failed to regenerate the town for years but all I can see now is devastation, dishevelled shops that look tired and unkempt. Alun walking around Porthcawl talking to the residents who have said they are still waiting for change, how long has our Labour council promised improvements to the town?

leaflet.personalStatement: If elected as your Member of Parliament I am determined to be a strong local voice, devoting my energy to securing a better future for our community.

contactInformation.address: Foresters House, Brombil, Margam, Nr Port Talbot SA13 2SR.

quotes.text: Vote UKIP. You know it makes sense, we need to hold the Conservatives & Labour to account.

While walking around Bridgend Town Centre I was shocked to see the desperate & dishevelled state of the town. Shops closed or closing everywhere. Dirty and rundown streets. What a change today! Our town leaders failed to regenerate the town for years but all I can see now is devastation, dishevelled shops that look tired and unkempt.
Alun is concerned that Theresa May is insincere about Brexit and was herself a REMAINER.

personalStories.story: As a person who until recently had a small business in both Bridgend and Porthcawl, I understand and share the concerns of retailers regarding rates and our Town centres becoming like 'ghost towns.'

examples: Vote UKIP. You know it makes sense, we need to hold the Conservatives & Labour to account.
While walking around Bridgend Town Centre I was shocked to see the desperate & dishevelled state of the town. Shops closed or closing everywhere.
Alun walking around Porthcawl talking to the residents who have said they are still waiting for change, how long has our Labour council promised improvements to the town?
Theresa May is insincere about Brexit and was herself a REMAINER.
